Intermediate-level instrumental music ed.content: # Erin Rainer - Honors Thesis Ideas - Purpose and scope of project - The **primary** purpose of this project is to collect, analyze, and synthesize best practices within intermediate-level instrumental music education. These include, but are not restricted to: - Beginner (6) instrument teaching (homogenous groupings) - Beginner (6) ensemble teaching - Intermediate (7-8) individual instrument pedagogy - Intermediate (7-8) ensemble pedagogy - Within the primary objective, a working knowledge of how these best practices function within short- and long-term instructional paradigms. This includes graduated levels of skill and concept development within and between grade levels (via curriculum and instruction), as well as the function of vertical alignment and teaming within and between districts. - A **secondary** purpose of this project is to collect ways in which band directors are adapting their existing paradigms to serve students during the COVID-19 Pandemic. Evaluations of success or failure in these adaptation will come from teachers, and threads of similarity will be drawn between COVID-adapted and traditional instructional tools. - A tertiary purpose of this project is to assist Erin in expanding her existing professional network within the Houston area. - Potential sites (limit 4) - Friendswood JH - Thomas Landfried (Friendswood ISD) - Creekside Int. - Ana Tran (Clear Creek SD) - Berry Miller JH - [Chris Bennett](https://www.notion.so/Chris-Bennett-b49d6abe6994492095c478c5f6c73a9b?pvs=21) (Pearland ISD) - Beverly Hills Int. - Dan Mullen (Pasadena ISD) - Nolan Ryan JH - Beau Hunter (Alvin ISD) - Crosby JH - Brandi Killough (Crosby ISD) - Anticipated outcomes - Collection of best practices across all domains encompassed by traditional intermediate-level instrumental music education. - Points of similarity and difference between techniques, strategies, concepts, and curricula. - Core principles of instruction that appear across instruments and instructional contexts (e.g., individual vs. ensemble). - A rough sketch of the best-practice progression across the first three years of a band student’s development. --- # Correspondence & Activity - **September 17, 2020** *Email to directors* > Hello, all- I'm sorry this has taken a little while for me to prepare and get back to you! I really appreciate all of your help with this. Right now, my plan is to send the questions for this topic in two sets; one with more open-ended questions (this set), and one with more closed-ended and opinion-based questions (the next set). You can expect the next set to most likely come around the very end of this month, or the beginning of October. This first set is probably a bit more time consuming, so I can also adapt the timeframe to fit whatever you need for this first set. I've attached both a Word Document and a link to a Google Form with the questions. Please feel free to use whichever is easiest for you! I know things are busy, and a Word Document has the benefit of being able to save your progress and close the document if you need to fill it out in short bursts, or whenever best fits your schedule. The link to the Form is below: [https://forms.gle/tXWSWK5Xz3zjcyvA7](https://forms.gle/tXWSWK5Xz3zjcyvA7) Again, I really appreciate your help with this, especially with this year's busy schedule for teachers! Please let me know if you have any questions at all, or if there are any issues with the attached documents. Thank you so much, and have a great rest of your week and weekend! Sincerely, -- Erin Rainer > [Beginner_Pedagogy_Homogenous.docx](Erin%20Rainer%20-%20Honors%20Thesis%20Ideas%20af288cff6ca245c58c4685472ba713e8/Beginner_Pedagogy_Homogenous.docx) - **October 5, 2020** > Hi, Dr. Meals- I know it's been a while since we touched base on this, but I wanted to ask if you think it'd be appropriate at this point for me to send out a gentle reminder to the directors participating in my questionnaire? Right now, the only response I've gotten is from Dan Mullen. I know that directors have had a crazy semester with COVID and the storms, but at this point I think they probably forgot. I can also start formulating the next set of questions (more opinion-based, Likert scale), so that I have those ready to go soon after I get responses for the first set. Just let me know what you think- thank you so much! Sincerely, -- Erin Rainer > --- *Email to directors:* > Hello, I hope you're doing well! I know things have been super busy this semester with the pandemic and with the storms, so I just wanted to bump this to the top of your inbox, and check in to see if you have any questions or need anything from me. If possible, my goal is to have all of the answers together in the next week or so, but if that is not possible for you, I totally understand and can definitely be flexible- just let me know if there's anything I can do to help! Thank you so much again for participating! Sincerely, -- Erin Rainer > - **October 9, 2020** > Hello, Dr. Meals- Thank you again for meeting with me today! I worked on fleshing out the questions we talked about this morning, and this is what I have right now: > [Questionnaire Part 2](https://forms.gle/mjEXXbo1jYQjczkF6) > If you have any suggestions for changes, please let me know! Thank you, and have a great weekend! Sincerely, -- Erin Rainer >

Group Instruction.content: # Questions - [10/14 - **Rural & Urban Schools Panel Questions**](Panels%20025fc4c06f8b4e11bccecaa5a28d22b1/10%2014%20-%20Rural%20and%20Urban%20Schools%205709308724374f5babb56983307b2015.md) - What are some common misconceptions about your teaching context (urban or rural) that you would like to correct? - Every teaching context has its challenges and benefits. What is one benefit unique to your community or context? - What unexpected challenges did you encounter (systemic or otherwise) in your current position, and how did you overcome them? - Over the course of your career, what is one consequential opinion that you have changed your mind on? Would your younger self be surprised by your change? - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design? - [10/16 - **Group Instruction Panel Questions**](Panels%20025fc4c06f8b4e11bccecaa5a28d22b1/10%2016%20-%20Group%20Instruction%204410dac15a044053b222921c459b48d6.md) - Aaron, Brad, Cliff, Shane - In your experience, what is the most difficult aspect of full-group instruction for young directors to learn and master? - Alex, Scott - Within this, what is the most difficult *structural* element of teaching large groups to master (e.g., information, repetition, feedback, other) - Alex, Scott, Cliff, Brad - How do you assess whether or not a large group is "getting" what you're teaching them? - Shane, Scott, Alex, Aaron - Over the course of your career, what is one consequential opinion that you have changed your mind on? Would your younger self be surprised by your change? - ALL - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design? - [10/21 - **Design Panel Questions**](Panels%20025fc4c06f8b4e11bccecaa5a28d22b1/10%2021%20-%20Design%20114926a6fdb14f009e6e9622a3fa85a2.md) - In a sentence or two, please share your personal guiding principles or philosophy of marching band design. **ALL PANELISTS** - In your experience, what is the most common mistake you see in design across marching band? - Dan Morrison, Jarrett Lipman, John Nelson - For a young director involved in their first design process, what are your top 1-2 suggestions to set them up for a productive experience? - Daniel Montoya, Jason Robb, Mike Howard - For many directors, the design process is as much coordination as it is creativity. Please briefly share how you balance these two in your own program. - Dan Morrison, Jarrett Lipman, John Nelson, Mike Howard - For the majority of directors, marching band can be a tremendous time commitment that - at times - verges on overload. What suggestions do you have, based on prior experience, for avoiding this common pitfall? - Daniel Montoya, Jason Robb - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design? **ALL PANELISTS - LIGHTNING ROUND** - [10/23 - **Individual Instruction Panel Questions**](Panels%20025fc4c06f8b4e11bccecaa5a28d22b1/10%2023%20-%20Individual%20Instruction%209461978be68f42f8ac339c65c12516c1.md) - In your experience, what is the greatest challenge young directors face when teaching individual students in a large ensemble like marching band? - Brett Nelson, Mike Ary, Christopher Brown - In this same vein, what is the most challenging performance-related skill set to develop in high-school-aged marching band students? - Levi Chavis, Todd Dixon, Stephen Lisko - With such a high student-teacher ratio, what are some strategies you prefer to assess student growth and development in marching band? - Todd Dixon, Mike Ary. Christopher Brown - Over the course of your career, what is one consequential opinion that you have changed your mind on? Would your younger self be surprised by your change? - Brett Nelson, Levi Chavis, Stephen Lisko - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design? - **ALL PANELISTS - LIGHTNING ROUND** - **ALPHA ORDER:** - Mike Ary - Christopher Brown - Levi Chavis - Todd Dixon - Stephen Lisko - Brett Nelson

Audience participation.content: # Ensemble Listening/Response You are listening to a recent performance recording of your ensemble, making notes on what to work on in your next rehearsal. You know that you will have time to address one segment of a work, focusing on a few aspects of the ensemble’s performance. Use the media and links below to identify your focus and create your plan. You will have 20 minutes of rehearsal to address whatever you identify in the performance, so be strategic and judicious in your analysis, diagnosis, and prescription. **Performance Links:** *Mantras -* mm. 97-end [2016成大管弦冬季音樂會(01) · Mantras · Richard Meyer](https://youtu.be/rADhYr4g9qk?t=240) *Choreography* - mm. 96-end [Choreography - Robert Sheldon | WJBO](https://youtu.be/S9VWpRgwvQI?t=259) **Ranking Page** [Poll Everywhere - Audience Participation Site](https://pollev.com/ranking_polls/x554Z1YN48XLbn11pwTgB/respond) **Analysis & Remediation Worksheet** [Ensemble Rehearsal Reflection Worksheet](https://forms.gle/puZ3bkfsT8PMJhWT6)

District Budget.content: # Lecture Notes - Budget Wrap-Up - Review - District Budget - Booster Budget - Activity Account - Workflows - Planning - Emergent Items / Emergencies - Needs spoken to by different budgets **Question Grid** A question grid is a series of interlinked questions that create a choice architecture promoting deeper thinking, consideration, and synthesis on the part of students. In structure and use, it resembles a Choose-Your-Own Adventure book. Each question presents a branching web of other questions that stem from the instigating decision. The differences are in the quantity of answers available to the reader/student (most CYOA books were binary choice architectures). Because these are used to promote deeper critical thought, they will represent more subtle gradations of choice within the embedded question. Additionally, these are graduated tiers of analysis, insight, and praxis within a given problem... therefore there is a more active role to be played by the target. Question grids can either be frameworks for verbal conversations or discussions (as in live classroom usage) or can be embedded within an interlinked set of pages (as in HTML, Roam, Notion). The benefit to their deployment in live discussion is that the central interlocutor can subtly or dramatically alter the contents of the decision tree depending on the content of the conversation. This allows for greater adaptation of the instrument to the educational goals of the class or the course. **Note:** There is nascent support for such a thing using [ML+NLP](https://towardsdatascience.com/natural-language-processing-nlp-for-machine-learning-d44498845d5b) and tools like [GPT-3](https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.14165).

Video Editing Software.content: # Pandemic "Virtual Ensemble" Problem - 13 November, 2020 ## **Equipment & *Mise en place*** - What are basic elements that all "performance captures" require? - Video + Audio Recording - Timeframe - Music *Your school and district will likely have an LMS (Learning Management System) that allows for the distribution of files or materials like music PDFs. If that is the case, use the provided LMS. If the functionality does not exist, however, some options are below.* - Dropbox [Dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com/) - Google Drive / Google Classroom [Classroom | Google for Education](https://edu.google.com/products/classroom/) - SmartMusic [SmartMusic | Music Learning Software for Educators & Students](https://www.smartmusic.com/) - MuseScore [Free music composition and notation software | MuseScore](https://musescore.org/en) - "What are the things that students will need to have in order to record at home?" - **Barebones** - Smartphone with built-in camera and microphone. - Many smartphones (e.g., iPhones) will automatically adjust audio levels in performance, making dynamic contrast minimal-to-nonexistent. - Many smartphone microphones are very sensitive, so extraneous noise can be an issue. - Zoom with external microphone (similar to what is used for class) - Students will need to record themselves using the screen capture feature of Zoom. - Some issues with video- and audio-compression may occur, depending on the student's computer specifications. - **Video Recording (minimum)** - Zoom with external microphone (similar to what is used for class) - Smartphone with built-in camera and microphone - DSLR or other digital camera with video recording capabilities *Very often DSLR or other digital cameras have mediocre sound recording capabilities, and will require an external microphone or parallel, high-quality audio recording.* - **External Mic (minimum)** *This assumes that students have a way to record audio alongside video capture, with the external microphone serving as the better option to the build-in microphone on their phone or computer* - USB Options [USB Microphones](https://www.sweetwater.com/c981--USB_Microphones) - 3.5mm (Headphone Jack) Options *Students will need to make sure their device has recording capabilities through a 3.5mm input (some laptops and desktops have separate headphone and microphone inputs).* [BOYA MM1 Cardioid Condenser Microphone BY-MM1 - Best Buy](https://www.bestbuy.com/site/boya-mm1-cardioid-condenser-microphone/6428773.p?skuId=6428773&ref=212&loc=1&ref=212&loc=1&ds_rl=1268655&gclid=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ABxYPL9erCUhUoyxmu8YnpqkpbvGN7vZ-4iW5IdJUEhYAWWwqKVxYcaAhTeEALw_wcB&gclsrc=aw.ds) - **School-Owned Check Out Microphones/Recording Device** *If your school or district has access to recording devices, you can check them out on a per-student basis.* [Zoom H1n 2-channel Handy Recorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H1n--zoom-h1n-handy-recorder) *The Zoom H1n (or any other audio-only recorder) assumes parallel video & audio recording, which complicates your job as the editor.* [Zoom Q8 2.3K HD Handy Video Recorder with Interchangeable Mic Capsule System](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/Q8Zoom--zoom-q8-2.3k-hd-handy-video-recorder-with-interchangeable-mic-capsule-system) - "What are the things that you will need to provide students with a recording experience at school (for students who can't record in their homes)?" - **Video Recording** - "Baseline" Level [](https://www.amazon.com/Logitech-C922x-Pro-Stream-Webcam/dp/B01LXCDPPK/ref=pd_lpo_147_t_0/141-9178369-3478041?_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_i=B01LXCDPPK&pd_rd_r=b984ccf3-b055-4f2a-afc0-a4761410ee07&pd_rd_w=5Ez20&pd_rd_wg=dR6EW&pf_rd_p=7b36d496-f366-4631-94d3-61b87b52511b&pf_rd_r=JRA22SZX34Z6CVWFA974&psc=1&refRID=JRA22SZX34Z6CVWFA974) [Zoom Q8 2.3K HD Handy Video Recorder with Interchangeable Mic Capsule System](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/Q8Zoom--zoom-q8-2.3k-hd-handy-video-recorder-with-interchangeable-mic-capsule-system) - "Prosumer" Level [Sony HDR-CX675 Handycam 1080p Full HD Camcorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/HDRCX675--sony-hdr-cx675-handycam-1080p-full-hd-camcorder) [Canon EOS RP Mirrorless Digital Camera with 24-105mm f/4-7.1 Lens](https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1558260-REG/canon_3380c132_eos_rp_mirrorless_digital.html) - "My School Has a Ridiculous Media Club" Level [Panasonic AG-CX350 4K Camcorder](https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1545631-REG/panasonic_ag_cx350pj5_ag_cx350_4k_camcorder.html) [Blackmagic Design URSA Broadcast Camera Kit with Fujinon 2/3" Mount LA16x8BRM-XB1A Lens](https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1480525-REG/blackmagic_design_ursa_broadcast_camera_kit.html) - **Audio Recording** - "Baseline" Level [Zoom H1n 2-channel Handy Recorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H1n--zoom-h1n-handy-recorder) [Blue Microphones Yeti X USB Condenser Microphone](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/YetiX--blue-microphones-yeti-by-usb-condenser-microphone) *The Blue Yeti (or any USB microphone) will need to be connected to a computer and compatible with audio recording software (e.g., Logic Pro, Ableton, Audacity).* - "Prosumer" Level [Zoom H4n Pro Handy Recorder - Black](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H4nProBlk--zoom-h4n-pro-handy-recorder-black) *This is the highest level of "all-in-one" audio recorders. All other self-contained units can use an external microphone, often with [XLR connections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XLR_connector) (e.g., Shure SM57)* [Zoom H6 All Black Handy Recorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H6Blk--zoom-h6-all-black-handy-recorder) [Shure SM57 Cardioid Dynamic Instrument Microphone](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/SM57--shure-sm57-cardioid-dynamic-instrument-microphone) - "We Had Extra Budget Money a Few Years Ago" Level [Heritage Audio HA73EQ + Shure SM7B Vocal Recording Package](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/SM7B-HA73EQ--heritage-audio-ha73eq-and-shure-sm7b-vocal-recording-package) [Focusrite Casey Cooper Content Creator Drum Recording Pack](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/CooperBun1--focusrite-casey-cooper-content-creator-drum-recording-pack) *These options require a computer to serve as the recording device, likely running an application like Audacity, Ableton, Logic Pro, or similar.* - "How will you (the teacher/editor) collect your student's submissions?" - Digital vs. Analog Delivery - Internet - For large files, use: [https://wetransfer.com/](https://wetransfer.com/) - Hand-Delivery (USB Thumbdrive) - Google Drive / Google Classroom - Shared Drives - no filesize caps - Dropbox - Microsoft Teams / Sharepoint - FlipGrid (requires A/V in same file) - "What are the tools you (the teacher/editor) will need to edit your student's submissions?" - **Video Editing Software** - iMovie [iMovie](https://www.apple.com/imovie/) - Windows Video Editor [Meet Video Editor](https://education.microsoft.com/en-us/resource/1febf818) - OpenShot Video Editor [OpenShot Video Editor | Free, Open, and Award-Winning Video Editor for Linux, Mac, and Windows!](https://www.openshot.org/) - DaVinci Resolve [DaVinci Resolve 17](https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/davinciresolve/) - Adobe Premiere Pro [Professional video editor | Adobe Premiere Pro](https://www.adobe.com/products/premiere.html?promoid=PQ7SQBYQ&mv=other) - Final Cut Pro [‎Final Cut Pro](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/final-cut-pro/id424389933?gclid=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&ign-itscg=20200&ign-itsct=rv_FCP_google&mt=12&mttnagencyid=2433&mttncc=US&mttnpid=305109&mttnsiteid=141192&mttnsub1=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&mttnsub2=c-1751245399-ag-68842611496-ad-433627388346-k-kwd-15028640&mttnsubad=68842611496&mttnsubsite=AppleFinalCutPro) - **Audio Editing Software** - GarageBand [GarageBand for Mac](https://www.apple.com/mac/garageband/) - Audacity [](https://www.audacityteam.org/) - Abelton Live [What's new in Live 11 | Ableton](https://www.ableton.com/en/live/) - Reaper [REAPER | Audio Production Without Limits](https://www.reaper.fm/) - Adobe Audition [Audio recording and editing software | Adobe Audition](https://www.adobe.com/products/audition.html) - Logic Pro [Logic Pro](https://www.apple.com/logic-pro/) - "What are the tools you (the teacher/editor) will need to share the created "virtual ensemble" performance? - YouTube [YouTube](https://studio.youtube.com/) - Vimeo [Vimeo: Watch, upload, and share HD and 4K videos with no ads](https://vimeo.com/) - Facebook [Facebook Watch](https://www.facebook.com/videos) - Instagram [Welcome to IGTV, our New Video App | Instagram Blog](https://about.instagram.com/blog/announcements/welcome-to-igtv) - School/District Website *This will likely integrate into your school or district's LMS, so the method of deployment/sharing will vary depending on the specifics of the system in use.* ## Instructions - "What information do your students need to complete the assignment?" - Music - Where to collect parts *See mise en place* - How to record performance - Use rubric language to explain what a 'successful' performance looks like. - What do to when the student makes a mistake - How to decided between performance takes - Are students allowed to splice good takes together or not? - Where to submit recordings *See mise en place* - Synchronization Information - Click-track - Sync-signal - Transitions (tempo changes) - Silence at beginning and end of track - Acoustics *Help students to problem solve these answers:* - What to do if there is too much echo in the room? - Where are good places to record in a house or apartment? - What can students do to reduce echo in a room? - Attire & Location - What is concert attire for this performance? - What sort of background should the student seek? - What sorts of camera angles are best? - What sorts of microphone placements work best? - Timeframe - When is the assignment released? - How much time will students have to work up their parts? - How will the teacher informally assess student progress? - When is the final submission due? - Technology Support - What to do when things go wrong? - Student phone/contact tree? - District IT? - Director email? ## Collection - Online Collection Site - Digital vs. Analog Delivery - Internet - For large files, use: [https://wetransfer.com/](https://wetransfer.com/) - Hand-Delivery (USB Thumbdrive) - Google Drive / Google Classroom - Shared Drives - no filesize caps - Dropbox - Microsoft Teams / Sharepoint - FlipGrid (requires A/V in same file) ## Performance Creation - Editing & Creation Software - Video Editing Software - iMovie [iMovie](https://www.apple.com/imovie/) - Windows Video Editor [Meet Video Editor](https://education.microsoft.com/en-us/resource/1febf818) - OpenShot Video Editor [OpenShot Video Editor | Free, Open, and Award-Winning Video Editor for Linux, Mac, and Windows!](https://www.openshot.org/) - DaVinci Resolve [DaVinci Resolve 17](https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/davinciresolve/) - Adobe Premiere Pro [Professional video editor | Adobe Premiere Pro](https://www.adobe.com/products/premiere.html?promoid=PQ7SQBYQ&mv=other) - Final Cut Pro [‎Final Cut Pro](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/final-cut-pro/id424389933?gclid=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&ign-itscg=20200&ign-itsct=rv_FCP_google&mt=12&mttnagencyid=2433&mttncc=US&mttnpid=305109&mttnsiteid=141192&mttnsub1=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&mttnsub2=c-1751245399-ag-68842611496-ad-433627388346-k-kwd-15028640&mttnsubad=68842611496&mttnsubsite=AppleFinalCutPro) - Audio Editing Software - GarageBand [GarageBand for Mac](https://www.apple.com/mac/garageband/) - Audacity [](https://www.audacityteam.org/) - Abelton Live [What's new in Live 11 | Ableton](https://www.ableton.com/en/live/) - Reaper [REAPER | Audio Production Without Limits](https://www.reaper.fm/) - Adobe Audition [Audio recording and editing software | Adobe Audition](https://www.adobe.com/products/audition.html) - Logic Pro [Logic Pro](https://www.apple.com/logic-pro/) - Technological Constraints - Laptop vs. Desktop Editing [https://youtu.be/qycd3scMyS4](https://youtu.be/qycd3scMyS4) - Computer Specifications to Consider: - Processor Speed and Power - [Best processor for editing](https://www.techradar.com/news/best-video-editing-computer) - [Intel vs. Apple M1](https://www.macrumors.com/guide/apple-silicon-mac-mini-vs-intel-mac-mini/) - Memory Quantity and Speed "Hardware Performance Guide: Serious 4K Editing" [](https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/guides/workstation-adobe-4k-guide.pdf) - Graphics Card - Desktop - [Internal](https://www.pcmag.com/picks/the-best-graphics-cards) - Laptop - [External](https://www.laptopmag.com/articles/best-egpus) - Timeframe & Calendar - What is the learning curve for your chosen/provided software? - What is your average time-per-video for the following steps: - Preparing the video: *Checking size, sound level, quality, etc...* - Sorting the videos: - *What instruments go together? What parts go together?* - *How to organize the files to make the creation process faster?* - Combining videos together in the editor - What is a reasonable amount of time to spend per day on this project? - With 56 students in the ensemble, your total time for the project might be: - 30 minutes per video = 28 total hours of work - 20 minutes per video = 18.75 hours of work - 10 minutes per video = 9.5 hours of work - **HERE BE BURNOUT - PACE THYSELF** ## Distribution & Sharing - Media Release Policy - District or School Level - Larger districts often have a media release form that allows them to photograph or record students in the district for marketing or archival purposes. This is often included in a packet of forms at the beginning of a school year or the first year on a campus. This may allow for blanket permission, but you need to check your roster again the clearances held by the district. HISD Example Form [](https://www.houstonisd.org/cms/lib2/TX01001591/Centricity/Domain/30442/Student-Media-Consent-and-Release-Form-doc-Final.pdf) - If you have students who are not able or willing to be individually recorded for public broadcast, the best practice is to include them in some form or fashion. It is strongly recommended that the students and their parents have input into how the student might participate in this project, with many options offered. These can include: - Blurring their face through video editing technology - Omitting their video, but including their audio - Having students create animated avatars (instead of video recording) - Copyright - For non-monetized streams, your options depend on who holds the rights to the music. - Self-published: Email the composer for permission to stream - Each composer will have differing requirements and regulations, but most are fine with a non-monetized, streaming performance so long as permission is sought and credit is given to the composer on the video - Large publishing firms: Reach out to larger entities like [Tresona](https://tresonamusic.com/) for guidance - Note that legal advice and representation tends to be billed by the hour - This is a good resource for general information [Copyright-US - MOLA](https://mola-inc.org/p/copyright-us) - Audience & Longevity - How long do you leave the performance up? - How do you market the performance? - Do you restrict the video through *unlisted* sources, or make it public?

Audio Editing Software.content: # Pandemic "Virtual Ensemble" Problem - 13 November, 2020 ## **Equipment & *Mise en place*** - What are basic elements that all "performance captures" require? - Video + Audio Recording - Timeframe - Music *Your school and district will likely have an LMS (Learning Management System) that allows for the distribution of files or materials like music PDFs. If that is the case, use the provided LMS. If the functionality does not exist, however, some options are below.* - Dropbox [Dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com/) - Google Drive / Google Classroom [Classroom | Google for Education](https://edu.google.com/products/classroom/) - SmartMusic [SmartMusic | Music Learning Software for Educators & Students](https://www.smartmusic.com/) - MuseScore [Free music composition and notation software | MuseScore](https://musescore.org/en) - "What are the things that students will need to have in order to record at home?" - **Barebones** - Smartphone with built-in camera and microphone. - Many smartphones (e.g., iPhones) will automatically adjust audio levels in performance, making dynamic contrast minimal-to-nonexistent. - Many smartphone microphones are very sensitive, so extraneous noise can be an issue. - Zoom with external microphone (similar to what is used for class) - Students will need to record themselves using the screen capture feature of Zoom. - Some issues with video- and audio-compression may occur, depending on the student's computer specifications. - **Video Recording (minimum)** - Zoom with external microphone (similar to what is used for class) - Smartphone with built-in camera and microphone - DSLR or other digital camera with video recording capabilities *Very often DSLR or other digital cameras have mediocre sound recording capabilities, and will require an external microphone or parallel, high-quality audio recording.* - **External Mic (minimum)** *This assumes that students have a way to record audio alongside video capture, with the external microphone serving as the better option to the build-in microphone on their phone or computer* - USB Options [USB Microphones](https://www.sweetwater.com/c981--USB_Microphones) - 3.5mm (Headphone Jack) Options *Students will need to make sure their device has recording capabilities through a 3.5mm input (some laptops and desktops have separate headphone and microphone inputs).* [BOYA MM1 Cardioid Condenser Microphone BY-MM1 - Best Buy](https://www.bestbuy.com/site/boya-mm1-cardioid-condenser-microphone/6428773.p?skuId=6428773&ref=212&loc=1&ref=212&loc=1&ds_rl=1268655&gclid=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ABxYPL9erCUhUoyxmu8YnpqkpbvGN7vZ-4iW5IdJUEhYAWWwqKVxYcaAhTeEALw_wcB&gclsrc=aw.ds) - **School-Owned Check Out Microphones/Recording Device** *If your school or district has access to recording devices, you can check them out on a per-student basis.* [Zoom H1n 2-channel Handy Recorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H1n--zoom-h1n-handy-recorder) *The Zoom H1n (or any other audio-only recorder) assumes parallel video & audio recording, which complicates your job as the editor.* [Zoom Q8 2.3K HD Handy Video Recorder with Interchangeable Mic Capsule System](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/Q8Zoom--zoom-q8-2.3k-hd-handy-video-recorder-with-interchangeable-mic-capsule-system) - "What are the things that you will need to provide students with a recording experience at school (for students who can't record in their homes)?" - **Video Recording** - "Baseline" Level [](https://www.amazon.com/Logitech-C922x-Pro-Stream-Webcam/dp/B01LXCDPPK/ref=pd_lpo_147_t_0/141-9178369-3478041?_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_i=B01LXCDPPK&pd_rd_r=b984ccf3-b055-4f2a-afc0-a4761410ee07&pd_rd_w=5Ez20&pd_rd_wg=dR6EW&pf_rd_p=7b36d496-f366-4631-94d3-61b87b52511b&pf_rd_r=JRA22SZX34Z6CVWFA974&psc=1&refRID=JRA22SZX34Z6CVWFA974) [Zoom Q8 2.3K HD Handy Video Recorder with Interchangeable Mic Capsule System](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/Q8Zoom--zoom-q8-2.3k-hd-handy-video-recorder-with-interchangeable-mic-capsule-system) - "Prosumer" Level [Sony HDR-CX675 Handycam 1080p Full HD Camcorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/HDRCX675--sony-hdr-cx675-handycam-1080p-full-hd-camcorder) [Canon EOS RP Mirrorless Digital Camera with 24-105mm f/4-7.1 Lens](https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1558260-REG/canon_3380c132_eos_rp_mirrorless_digital.html) - "My School Has a Ridiculous Media Club" Level [Panasonic AG-CX350 4K Camcorder](https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1545631-REG/panasonic_ag_cx350pj5_ag_cx350_4k_camcorder.html) [Blackmagic Design URSA Broadcast Camera Kit with Fujinon 2/3" Mount LA16x8BRM-XB1A Lens](https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1480525-REG/blackmagic_design_ursa_broadcast_camera_kit.html) - **Audio Recording** - "Baseline" Level [Zoom H1n 2-channel Handy Recorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H1n--zoom-h1n-handy-recorder) [Blue Microphones Yeti X USB Condenser Microphone](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/YetiX--blue-microphones-yeti-by-usb-condenser-microphone) *The Blue Yeti (or any USB microphone) will need to be connected to a computer and compatible with audio recording software (e.g., Logic Pro, Ableton, Audacity).* - "Prosumer" Level [Zoom H4n Pro Handy Recorder - Black](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H4nProBlk--zoom-h4n-pro-handy-recorder-black) *This is the highest level of "all-in-one" audio recorders. All other self-contained units can use an external microphone, often with [XLR connections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XLR_connector) (e.g., Shure SM57)* [Zoom H6 All Black Handy Recorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H6Blk--zoom-h6-all-black-handy-recorder) [Shure SM57 Cardioid Dynamic Instrument Microphone](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/SM57--shure-sm57-cardioid-dynamic-instrument-microphone) - "We Had Extra Budget Money a Few Years Ago" Level [Heritage Audio HA73EQ + Shure SM7B Vocal Recording Package](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/SM7B-HA73EQ--heritage-audio-ha73eq-and-shure-sm7b-vocal-recording-package) [Focusrite Casey Cooper Content Creator Drum Recording Pack](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/CooperBun1--focusrite-casey-cooper-content-creator-drum-recording-pack) *These options require a computer to serve as the recording device, likely running an application like Audacity, Ableton, Logic Pro, or similar.* - HISD Example Form [](https://www.houstonisd.org/cms/lib2/TX01001591/Centricity/Domain/30442/Student-Media-Consent-and-Release-Form-doc-Final.pdf) - If you have students who are not able or willing to be individually recorded for public broadcast, the best practice is to include them in some form or fashion. It is strongly recommended that the students and their parents have input into how the student might participate in this project, with many options offered. These can include: - Blurring their face through video editing technology - Omitting their video, but including their audio - Having students create animated avatars (instead of video recording) - Copyright - For non-monetized streams, your options depend on who holds the rights to the music. - Self-published: Email the composer for permission to stream - Each composer will have differing requirements and regulations, but most are fine with a non-monetized, streaming performance so long as permission is sought and credit is given to the composer on the video - Large publishing firms: Reach out to larger entities like [Tresona](https://tresonamusic.com/) for guidance - Note that legal advice and representation tends to be billed by the hour - This is a good resource for general information [Copyright-US - MOLA](https://mola-inc.org/p/copyright-us) - Audience & Longevity - How long do you leave the performance up? - How do you market the performance? - Do you restrict the video through *unlisted* sources, or make it public?

Technology Support.content: # Pandemic "Virtual Ensemble" Problem - 13 November, 2020 ## **Equipment & *Mise en place*** - What are basic elements that all "performance captures" require? - Video + Audio Recording - Timeframe - Music *Your school and district will likely have an LMS (Learning Management System) that allows for the distribution of files or materials like music PDFs. If that is the case, use the provided LMS. If the functionality does not exist, however, some options are below.* - Dropbox [Dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com/) - Google Drive / Google Classroom [Classroom | Google for Education](https://edu.google.com/products/classroom/) - SmartMusic [SmartMusic | Music Learning Software for Educators & Students](https://www.smartmusic.com/) - MuseScore [Free music composition and notation software | MuseScore](https://musescore.org/en) - "What are the things that students will need to have in order to record at home?" - **Barebones** - Smartphone with built-in camera and microphone. - Many smartphones (e.g., iPhones) will automatically adjust audio levels in performance, making dynamic contrast minimal-to-nonexistent. - Many smartphone microphones are very sensitive, so extraneous noise can be an issue. - Zoom with external microphone (similar to what is used for class) - Students will need to record themselves using the screen capture feature of Zoom. - Some issues with video- and audio-compression may occur, depending on the student's computer specifications. - **Video Recording (minimum)** - Zoom with external microphone (similar to what is used for class) - Smartphone with built-in camera and microphone - DSLR or other digital camera with video recording capabilities *Very often DSLR or other digital cameras have mediocre sound recording capabilities, and will require an external microphone or parallel, high-quality audio recording.* - **External Mic (minimum)** *This assumes that students have a way to record audio alongside video capture, with the external microphone serving as the better option to the build-in microphone on their phone or computer* - USB Options [USB Microphones](https://www.sweetwater.com/c981--USB_Microphones) - 3.5mm (Headphone Jack) Options *Students will need to make sure their device has recording capabilities through a 3.5mm input (some laptops and desktops have separate headphone and microphone inputs).* [BOYA MM1 Cardioid Condenser Microphone BY-MM1 - Best Buy](https://www.bestbuy.com/site/boya-mm1-cardioid-condenser-microphone/6428773.p?skuId=6428773&ref=212&loc=1&ref=212&loc=1&ds_rl=1268655&gclid=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ABxYPL9erCUhUoyxmu8YnpqkpbvGN7vZ-4iW5IdJUEhYAWWwqKVxYcaAhTeEALw_wcB&gclsrc=aw.ds) - **School-Owned Check Out Microphones/Recording Device** *If your school or district has access to recording devices, you can check them out on a per-student basis.* [Zoom H1n 2-channel Handy Recorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H1n--zoom-h1n-handy-recorder) *The Zoom H1n (or any other audio-only recorder) assumes parallel video & audio recording, which complicates your job as the editor.* [Zoom Q8 2.3K HD Handy Video Recorder with Interchangeable Mic Capsule System](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/Q8Zoom--zoom-q8-2.3k-hd-handy-video-recorder-with-interchangeable-mic-capsule-system) - "What are the things that you will need to provide students with a recording experience at school (for students who can't record in their homes)?" - **Video Recording** - "Baseline" Level [](https://www.amazon.com/Logitech-C922x-Pro-Stream-Webcam/dp/B01LXCDPPK/ref=pd_lpo_147_t_0/141-9178369-3478041?_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_i=B01LXCDPPK&pd_rd_r=b984ccf3-b055-4f2a-afc0-a4761410ee07&pd_rd_w=5Ez20&pd_rd_wg=dR6EW&pf_rd_p=7b36d496-f366-4631-94d3-61b87b52511b&pf_rd_r=JRA22SZX34Z6CVWFA974&psc=1&refRID=JRA22SZX34Z6CVWFA974) [Zoom Q8 2.3K HD Handy Video Recorder with Interchangeable Mic Capsule System](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/Q8Zoom--zoom-q8-2.3k-hd-handy-video-recorder-with-interchangeable-mic-capsule-system) - "Prosumer" Level [Sony HDR-CX675 Handycam 1080p Full HD Camcorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/HDRCX675--sony-hdr-cx675-handycam-1080p-full-hd-camcorder) [Canon EOS RP Mirrorless Digital Camera with 24-105mm f/4-7.1 Lens](https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1558260-REG/canon_3380c132_eos_rp_mirrorless_digital.html) - "My School Has a Ridiculous Media Club" Level [Panasonic AG-CX350 4K Camcorder](https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1545631-REG/panasonic_ag_cx350pj5_ag_cx350_4k_camcorder.html) [Blackmagic Design URSA Broadcast Camera Kit with Fujinon 2/3" Mount LA16x8BRM-XB1A Lens](https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/product/1480525-REG/blackmagic_design_ursa_broadcast_camera_kit.html) - **Audio Recording** - "Baseline" Level [Zoom H1n 2-channel Handy Recorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H1n--zoom-h1n-handy-recorder) [Blue Microphones Yeti X USB Condenser Microphone](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/YetiX--blue-microphones-yeti-by-usb-condenser-microphone) *The Blue Yeti (or any USB microphone) will need to be connected to a computer and compatible with audio recording software (e.g., Logic Pro, Ableton, Audacity).* - "Prosumer" Level [Zoom H4n Pro Handy Recorder - Black](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H4nProBlk--zoom-h4n-pro-handy-recorder-black) *This is the highest level of "all-in-one" audio recorders. All other self-contained units can use an external microphone, often with [XLR connections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XLR_connector) (e.g., Shure SM57)* [Zoom H6 All Black Handy Recorder](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/H6Blk--zoom-h6-all-black-handy-recorder) [Shure SM57 Cardioid Dynamic Instrument Microphone](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/SM57--shure-sm57-cardioid-dynamic-instrument-microphone) - "We Had Extra Budget Money a Few Years Ago" Level [Heritage Audio HA73EQ + Shure SM7B Vocal Recording Package](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/SM7B-HA73EQ--heritage-audio-ha73eq-and-shure-sm7b-vocal-recording-package) [Focusrite Casey Cooper Content Creator Drum Recording Pack](https://www.sweetwater.com/store/detail/CooperBun1--focusrite-casey-cooper-content-creator-drum-recording-pack) *These options require a computer to serve as the recording device, likely running an application like Audacity, Ableton, Logic Pro, or similar.* - "How will you (the teacher/editor) collect your student's submissions?" - Digital vs. Analog Delivery - Internet - For large files, use: [https://wetransfer.com/](https://wetransfer.com/) - Hand-Delivery (USB Thumbdrive) - Google Drive / Google Classroom - Shared Drives - no filesize caps - Dropbox - Microsoft Teams / Sharepoint - FlipGrid (requires A/V in same file) - "What are the tools you (the teacher/editor) will need to edit your student's submissions?" - **Video Editing Software** - iMovie [iMovie](https://www.apple.com/imovie/) - Windows Video Editor [Meet Video Editor](https://education.microsoft.com/en-us/resource/1febf818) - OpenShot Video Editor [OpenShot Video Editor | Free, Open, and Award-Winning Video Editor for Linux, Mac, and Windows!](https://www.openshot.org/) - DaVinci Resolve [DaVinci Resolve 17](https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/davinciresolve/) - Adobe Premiere Pro [Professional video editor | Adobe Premiere Pro](https://www.adobe.com/products/premiere.html?promoid=PQ7SQBYQ&mv=other) - Final Cut Pro [‎Final Cut Pro](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/final-cut-pro/id424389933?gclid=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&ign-itscg=20200&ign-itsct=rv_FCP_google&mt=12&mttnagencyid=2433&mttncc=US&mttnpid=305109&mttnsiteid=141192&mttnsub1=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&mttnsub2=c-1751245399-ag-68842611496-ad-433627388346-k-kwd-15028640&mttnsubad=68842611496&mttnsubsite=AppleFinalCutPro) - **Audio Editing Software** - GarageBand [GarageBand for Mac](https://www.apple.com/mac/garageband/) - Audacity [](https://www.audacityteam.org/) - Abelton Live [What's new in Live 11 | Ableton](https://www.ableton.com/en/live/) - Reaper [REAPER | Audio Production Without Limits](https://www.reaper.fm/) - Adobe Audition [Audio recording and editing software | Adobe Audition](https://www.adobe.com/products/audition.html) - Logic Pro [Logic Pro](https://www.apple.com/logic-pro/) - "What are the tools you (the teacher/editor) will need to share the created "virtual ensemble" performance? - YouTube [YouTube](https://studio.youtube.com/) - Vimeo [Vimeo: Watch, upload, and share HD and 4K videos with no ads](https://vimeo.com/) - Facebook [Facebook Watch](https://www.facebook.com/videos) - Instagram [Welcome to IGTV, our New Video App | Instagram Blog](https://about.instagram.com/blog/announcements/welcome-to-igtv) - School/District Website *This will likely integrate into your school or district's LMS, so the method of deployment/sharing will vary depending on the specifics of the system in use.* ## Instructions - "What information do your students need to complete the assignment?" - Music - Where to collect parts *See mise en place* - How to record performance - Use rubric language to explain what a 'successful' performance looks like. - What do to when the student makes a mistake - How to decided between performance takes - Are students allowed to splice good takes together or not? - Where to submit recordings *See mise en place* - Synchronization Information - Click-track - Sync-signal - Transitions (tempo changes) - Silence at beginning and end of track - Acoustics *Help students to problem solve these answers:* - What to do if there is too much echo in the room? - Where are good places to record in a house or apartment? - What can students do to reduce echo in a room? - Attire & Location - What is concert attire for this performance? - What sort of background should the student seek? - What sorts of camera angles are best? - What sorts of microphone placements work best? - Timeframe - When is the assignment released? - How much time will students have to work up their parts? - How will the teacher informally assess student progress? - When is the final submission due? - Technology Support - What to do when things go wrong? - Student phone/contact tree? - District IT? - Director email? ## Collection - Online Collection Site - Digital vs. Analog Delivery - Internet - For large files, use: [https://wetransfer.com/](https://wetransfer.com/) - Hand-Delivery (USB Thumbdrive) - Google Drive / Google Classroom - Shared Drives - no filesize caps - Dropbox - Microsoft Teams / Sharepoint - FlipGrid (requires A/V in same file) ## Performance Creation - Editing & Creation Software - Video Editing Software - iMovie [iMovie](https://www.apple.com/imovie/) - Windows Video Editor [Meet Video Editor](https://education.microsoft.com/en-us/resource/1febf818) - OpenShot Video Editor [OpenShot Video Editor | Free, Open, and Award-Winning Video Editor for Linux, Mac, and Windows!](https://www.openshot.org/) - DaVinci Resolve [DaVinci Resolve 17](https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/davinciresolve/) - Adobe Premiere Pro [Professional video editor | Adobe Premiere Pro](https://www.adobe.com/products/premiere.html?promoid=PQ7SQBYQ&mv=other) - Final Cut Pro [‎Final Cut Pro](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/final-cut-pro/id424389933?gclid=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&ign-itscg=20200&ign-itsct=rv_FCP_google&mt=12&mttnagencyid=2433&mttncc=US&mttnpid=305109&mttnsiteid=141192&mttnsub1=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&mttnsub2=c-1751245399-ag-68842611496-ad-433627388346-k-kwd-15028640&mttnsubad=68842611496&mttnsubsite=AppleFinalCutPro) - Audio Editing Software - GarageBand [GarageBand for Mac](https://www.apple.com/mac/garageband/) - Audacity [](https://www.audacityteam.org/) - Abelton Live [What's new in Live 11 | Ableton](https://www.ableton.com/en/live/) - Reaper [REAPER | Audio Production Without Limits](https://www.reaper.fm/) - Adobe Audition [Audio recording and editing software | Adobe Audition](https://www.adobe.com/products/audition.html) - Logic Pro [Logic Pro](https://www.apple.com/logic-pro/) - Technological Constraints - Laptop vs. Desktop Editing [https://youtu.be/qycd3scMyS4](https://youtu.be/qycd3scMyS4) - Computer Specifications to Consider: - Processor Speed and Power - [Best processor for editing](https://www.techradar.com/news/best-video-editing-computer) - [Intel vs. Apple M1](https://www.macrumors.com/guide/apple-silicon-mac-mini-vs-intel-mac-mini/) - Memory Quantity and Speed "Hardware Performance Guide: Serious 4K Editing" [](https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/guides/workstation-adobe-4k-guide.pdf) - Graphics Card - Desktop - [Internal](https://www.pcmag.com/picks/the-best-graphics-cards) - Laptop - [External](https://www.laptopmag.com/articles/best-egpus) - Timeframe & Calendar - What is the learning curve for your chosen/provided software? - What is your average time-per-video for the following steps: - Preparing the video: *Checking size, sound level, quality, etc...* - Sorting the videos: - *What instruments go together? What parts go together?* - *How to organize the files to make the creation process faster?* - Combining videos together in the editor - What is a reasonable amount of time to spend per day on this project? - With 56 students in the ensemble, your total time for the project might be: - 30 minutes per video = 28 total hours of work - 20 minutes per video = 18.75 hours of work - 10 minutes per video = 9.5 hours of work - **HERE BE BURNOUT - PACE THYSELF** ## Distribution & Sharing - Media Release Policy - District or School Level - Larger districts often have a media release form that allows them to photograph or record students in the district for marketing or archival purposes. This is often included in a packet of forms at the beginning of a school year or the first year on a campus. This may allow for blanket permission, but you need to check your roster again the clearances held by the district. HISD Example Form [](https://www.houstonisd.org/cms/lib2/TX01001591/Centricity/Domain/30442/Student-Media-Consent-and-Release-Form-doc-Final.pdf) - If you have students who are not able or willing to be individually recorded for public broadcast, the best practice is to include them in some form or fashion. It is strongly recommended that the students and their parents have input into how the student might participate in this project, with many options offered. These can include: - Blurring their face through video editing technology - Omitting their video, but including their audio - Having students create animated avatars (instead of video recording) - Copyright - For non-monetized streams, your options depend on who holds the rights to the music. - Self-published: Email the composer for permission to stream - Each composer will have differing requirements and regulations, but most are fine with a non-monetized, streaming performance so long as permission is sought and credit is given to the composer on the video - Large publishing firms: Reach out to larger entities like [Tresona](https://tresonamusic.com/) for guidance - Note that legal advice and representation tends to be billed by the hour - This is a good resource for general information [Copyright-US - MOLA](https://mola-inc.org/p/copyright-us) - Audience & Longevity - How long do you leave the performance up? - How do you market the performance? - Do you restrict the video through *unlisted* sources, or make it public?

Final Cut Pro [‎Final Cut Pro](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/final-cut-pro/id424389933?gclid=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&ign-itscg=20200&ign-itsct=rv_FCP_google&mt=12&mttnagencyid=2433&mttncc=US&mttnpid=305109&mttnsiteid=141192&mttnsub1=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&mttnsub2=c-1751245399-ag-68842611496-ad-433627388346-k-kwd-15028640&mttnsubad=68842611496&mttnsubsite=AppleFinalCutPro) - **Audio Editing Software** - GarageBand [GarageBand for Mac](https://www.apple.com/mac/garageband/) - Audacity [](https://www.audacityteam.org/) - Abelton Live [What's new in Live 11 | Ableton](https://www.ableton.com/en/live/) - Reaper [REAPER | Audio Production Without Limits](https://www.reaper.fm/) - Adobe Audition [Audio recording and editing software | Adobe Audition](https://www.adobe.com/products/audition.html) - Logic Pro [Logic Pro](https://www.apple.com/logic-pro/) - "What are the tools you (the teacher/editor) will need to share the created "virtual ensemble" performance? - YouTube [YouTube](https://studio.youtube.com/) - Vimeo [Vimeo: Watch, upload, and share HD and 4K videos with no ads](https://vimeo.com/) - Facebook [Facebook Watch](https://www.facebook.com/videos) - Instagram [Welcome to IGTV, our New Video App | Instagram Blog](https://about.instagram.com/blog/announcements/welcome-to-igtv) - School/District Website *This will likely integrate into your school or district's LMS, so the method of deployment/sharing will vary depending on the specifics of the system in use.* ## Instructions - "What information do your students need to complete the assignment?" - Music - Where to collect parts *See mise en place* - How to record performance - Use rubric language to explain what a 'successful' performance looks like. - What do to when the student makes a mistake - How to decided between performance takes - Are students allowed to splice good takes together or not? - Where to submit recordings *See mise en place* - Synchronization Information - Click-track - Sync-signal - Transitions (tempo changes) - Silence at beginning and end of track - Acoustics *Help students to problem solve these answers:* - What to do if there is too much echo in the room? - Where are good places to record in a house or apartment? - What can students do to reduce echo in a room? - Attire & Location - What is concert attire for this performance? - What sort of background should the student seek? - What sorts of camera angles are best? - What sorts of microphone placements work best? - Timeframe - When is the assignment released? - How much time will students have to work up their parts? - How will the teacher informally assess student progress? - When is the final submission due? - Technology Support - What to do when things go wrong? - Student phone/contact tree? - District IT? - Director email? ## Collection - Online Collection Site - Digital vs. Analog Delivery - Internet - For large files, use: [https://wetransfer.com/](https://wetransfer.com/) - Hand-Delivery (USB Thumbdrive) - Google Drive / Google Classroom - Shared Drives - no filesize caps - Dropbox - Microsoft Teams / Sharepoint - FlipGrid (requires A/V in same file) ## Performance Creation - Editing & Creation Software - Video Editing Software - iMovie [iMovie](https://www.apple.com/imovie/) - Windows Video Editor [Meet Video Editor](https://education.microsoft.com/en-us/resource/1febf818) - OpenShot Video Editor [OpenShot Video Editor | Free, Open, and Award-Winning Video Editor for Linux, Mac, and Windows!](https://www.openshot.org/) - DaVinci Resolve [DaVinci Resolve 17](https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/davinciresolve/) - Adobe Premiere Pro [Professional video editor | Adobe Premiere Pro](https://www.adobe.com/products/premiere.html?promoid=PQ7SQBYQ&mv=other) - Final Cut Pro [‎Final Cut Pro](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/final-cut-pro/id424389933?gclid=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&ign-itscg=20200&ign-itsct=rv_FCP_google&mt=12&mttnagencyid=2433&mttncc=US&mttnpid=305109&mttnsiteid=141192&mttnsub1=Cj0KCQiA-rj9BRCAARIsANB_4ADQqp8cNC2Scv9Rwrh0GnuBsYvhlQioXCa9LNFEwjTcE9dWt40W4HMaAklJEALw_wcB&mttnsub2=c-1751245399-ag-68842611496-ad-433627388346-k-kwd-15028640&mttnsubad=68842611496&mttnsubsite=AppleFinalCutPro) - Audio Editing Software - GarageBand [GarageBand for Mac](https://www.apple.com/mac/garageband/) - Audacity [](https://www.audacityteam.org/) - Abelton Live [What's new in Live 11 | Ableton](https://www.ableton.com/en/live/) - Reaper [REAPER | Audio Production Without Limits](https://www.reaper.fm/) - Adobe Audition [Audio recording and editing software | Adobe Audition](https://www.adobe.com/products/audition.html) - Logic Pro [Logic Pro](https://www.apple.com/logic-pro/) - Technological Constraints - Laptop vs. Desktop Editing [https://youtu.be/qycd3scMyS4](https://youtu.be/qycd3scMyS4) - Computer Specifications to Consider: - Processor Speed and Power - [Best processor for editing](https://www.techradar.com/news/best-video-editing-computer) - [Intel vs. Apple M1](https://www.macrumors.com/guide/apple-silicon-mac-mini-vs-intel-mac-mini/) - Memory Quantity and Speed "Hardware Performance Guide: Serious 4K Editing" [](https://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/guides/workstation-adobe-4k-guide.pdf) - Graphics Card - Desktop - [Internal](https://www.pcmag.com/picks/the-best-graphics-cards) - Laptop - [External](https://www.laptopmag.com/articles/best-egpus) - Timeframe & Calendar - What is the learning curve for your chosen/provided software? - What is your average time-per-video for the following steps: - Preparing the video: *Checking size, sound level, quality, etc...* - Sorting the videos: - *What instruments go together? What parts go together?* - *How to organize the files to make the creation process faster?* - Combining videos together in the editor - What is a reasonable amount of time to spend per day on this project? - With 56 students in the ensemble, your total time for the project might be: - 30 minutes per video = 28 total hours of work - 20 minutes per video = 18.75 hours of work - 10 minutes per video = 9.5 hours of work - **HERE BE BURNOUT - PACE THYSELF** ## Distribution & Sharing - Media Release Policy - District or School Level - Larger districts often have a media release form that allows them to photograph or record students in the district for marketing or archival purposes. This is often included in a packet of forms at the beginning of a school year or the first year on a campus. This may allow for blanket permission, but you need to check your roster again the clearances held by the district. HISD Example Form [](https://www.houstonisd.org/cms/lib2/TX01001591/Centricity/Domain/30442/Student-Media-Consent-and-Release-Form-doc-Final.pdf) - If you have students who are not able or willing to be individually recorded for public broadcast, the best practice is to include them in some form or fashion. It is strongly recommended that the students and their parents have input into how the student might participate in this project, with many options offered. These can include: - Blurring their face through video editing technology - Omitting their video, but including their audio - Having students create animated avatars (instead of video recording) - Copyright - For non-monetized streams, your options depend on who holds the rights to the music. - Self-published: Email the composer for permission to stream - Each composer will have differing requirements and regulations, but most are fine with a non-monetized, streaming performance so long as permission is sought and credit is given to the composer on the video - Large publishing firms: Reach out to larger entities like [Tresona](https://tresonamusic.com/) for guidance - Note that legal advice and representation tends to be billed by the hour - This is a good resource for general information [Copyright-US - MOLA](https://mola-inc.org/p/copyright-us) - Audience & Longevity - How long do you leave the performance up? - How do you market the performance? - Do you restrict the video through *unlisted* sources, or make it public?

Marching Band Design.content: # Questions - [10/14 - **Rural & Urban Schools Panel Questions**](Panels%20025fc4c06f8b4e11bccecaa5a28d22b1/10%2014%20-%20Rural%20and%20Urban%20Schools%205709308724374f5babb56983307b2015.md) - What are some common misconceptions about your teaching context (urban or rural) that you would like to correct? - Every teaching context has its challenges and benefits. What is one benefit unique to your community or context? - What unexpected challenges did you encounter (systemic or otherwise) in your current position, and how did you overcome them? - Over the course of your career, what is one consequential opinion that you have changed your mind on? Would your younger self be surprised by your change? - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design? - [10/16 - **Group Instruction Panel Questions**](Panels%20025fc4c06f8b4e11bccecaa5a28d22b1/10%2016%20-%20Group%20Instruction%204410dac15a044053b222921c459b48d6.md) - Aaron, Brad, Cliff, Shane - In your experience, what is the most difficult aspect of full-group instruction for young directors to learn and master? - Alex, Scott - Within this, what is the most difficult *structural* element of teaching large groups to master (e.g., information, repetition, feedback, other) - Alex, Scott, Cliff, Brad - How do you assess whether or not a large group is "getting" what you're teaching them? - Shane, Scott, Alex, Aaron - Over the course of your career, what is one consequential opinion that you have changed your mind on? Would your younger self be surprised by your change? - ALL - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design? - [10/21 - **Design Panel Questions**](Panels%20025fc4c06f8b4e11bccecaa5a28d22b1/10%2021%20-%20Design%20114926a6fdb14f009e6e9622a3fa85a2.md) - In a sentence or two, please share your personal guiding principles or philosophy of marching band design. **ALL PANELISTS** - In your experience, what is the most common mistake you see in design across marching band? - Dan Morrison, Jarrett Lipman, John Nelson - For a young director involved in their first design process, what are your top 1-2 suggestions to set them up for a productive experience? - Daniel Montoya, Jason Robb, Mike Howard - For many directors, the design process is as much coordination as it is creativity. Please briefly share how you balance these two in your own program. - Dan Morrison, Jarrett Lipman, John Nelson, Mike Howard - For the majority of directors, marching band can be a tremendous time commitment that - at times - verges on overload. What suggestions do you have, based on prior experience, for avoiding this common pitfall? - Daniel Montoya, Jason Robb - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design? **ALL PANELISTS - LIGHTNING ROUND** - [10/23 - **Individual Instruction Panel Questions**](Panels%20025fc4c06f8b4e11bccecaa5a28d22b1/10%2023%20-%20Individual%20Instruction%209461978be68f42f8ac339c65c12516c1.md) - In your experience, what is the greatest challenge young directors face when teaching individual students in a large ensemble like marching band? - Brett Nelson, Mike Ary, Christopher Brown - In this same vein, what is the most challenging performance-related skill set to develop in high-school-aged marching band students? - Levi Chavis, Todd Dixon, Stephen Lisko - With such a high student-teacher ratio, what are some strategies you prefer to assess student growth and development in marching band? - Todd Dixon, Mike Ary. Christopher Brown - Over the course of your career, what is one consequential opinion that you have changed your mind on? Would your younger self be surprised by your change? - Brett Nelson, Levi Chavis, Stephen Lisko - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design? - **ALL PANELISTS - LIGHTNING ROUND** - **ALPHA ORDER:** - Mike Ary - Christopher Brown - Levi Chavis - Todd Dixon - Stephen Lisko - Brett Nelson

MUED 4344 - Marching Band Methods.content: # Group Instruction Panel Date: October 16, 2020 Property: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/9643352012 Property 1: Topic: MUED 4344 - Marching Band Methods: Group Instruction Time: Oct 16, 2020 10:00 AM Central Time (US and Canada) https://us02web.zoom.us/j/9643352012Meeting ID: 964 335 2012 ### **Group Instruction - Oct. 16** [Untitled](Group%20Instruction%20Panel%20a60d069c11ef41b1887421ced5a45f5d/Untitled%20c68cabbd483345cc9e8c777fa0faf13f.csv) ### **Group Instruction Panel Questions** - In your experience, what is the most difficult aspect of full-group instruction for young directors to learn and master? - Within this, what is the most difficult *structural* element of teaching large groups to master (e.g., information, repetition, feedback, other) - How do you assess whether or not a large group is "getting" what you're teaching them? - Over the course of your career, what is one consequential opinion that you have changed your mind on? Would your younger self be surprised by your change? - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design?

Design Panel.content: # Design Panel Date: October 21, 2020 Property: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/9643352012 Property 1: Topic: MUED 4344 - Marching Band Methods: Design Time: Oct 21, 2020 10:00 AM Central Time (US and Canada) https://us02web.zoom.us/j/9643352012Meeting ID: 964 335 2012 ### **Design - Oct. 21** [Untitled](Design%20Panel%20006d574b486b47a6b6dd0d0d19624dd6/Untitled%209c4abaf2131f4529b795ccfb4f974953.csv) ### **Design Panel Questions** - In a sentence or two, please share your personal guiding principles or philosophy of marching band design. - In your experience, what is the most common mistake you see in design across marching band? - For a young director involved in their first design process, what are your top 1-2 suggestions to set them up for a productive experience? - For many directors, the design process is as much coordination as it is creativity. Please briefly share how you balance these two in your own program. - To your mind, what are the top two marching band or drum corps shows you've seen, performed in, instructed, or helped to design?
